acts.name: The Awakening
acts.intro_text: The Typhos Horde descends upon the Kingdom of Keystonia. Ancient keyboard magic may be our only hope...

boss.name: Shadow Scout Commander
boss.intro: A dark figure emerges from the shadows...
boss.taunt: Your fingers are weak, young scribe!
boss.defeat: Impossible! How did you master the home keys so quickly?
boss.lore: Once a scribe of Keystonia, corrupted by the Void.

acts.completion_text: You have awakened your keyboard magic. The home row is yours to command.

acts.name: Reaching Beyond
acts.intro_text: The Tower of Echoes awaits. There you will learn the upper incantations, keys that reach beyond the home row.

boss.name: Storm Wraith
boss.intro: Lightning crackles as a spectral form materializes...
boss.taunt: The upper keys are mine to control! You cannot reach them!
boss.defeat: The storm... subsides. Your reach grows stronger.
boss.lore: A spirit of chaos that haunts the Tower of Echoes.

acts.completion_text: The upper keys bend to your will. Your reach extends to new heights.

acts.name: The Depths
acts.intro_text: The Horde has breached the underground tunnels. You must descend and master the earth magic of the keys below.

boss.name: Stone Golem King
boss.intro: The earth trembles as massive stone hands emerge from the ground...
boss.taunt: I am the foundation! The bottom keys obey only ME!
boss.defeat: My... my stones crumble. You have grounded yourself well.
boss.lore: Ancient guardian corrupted by Typhos dark magic.

acts.completion_text: You have mastered the depths. All letter keys now answer your call.

acts.name: Full Power
acts.intro_text: Return to Keystonia with your full keyboard mastery. The time has come to push back the Typhos Horde!

boss.name: Typhos General
boss.intro: The commander of the Horde steps forward, dark energy swirling around his gauntlets...
boss.taunt: Fool! Speed alone cannot defeat me! I've crushed faster scribes than you!
boss.defeat: How... how can you type so fast? This is impossible!
boss.lore: The ruthless commander of the Typhos invasion force.

acts.completion_text: The Typhos army retreats. Your speed and accuracy are legendary.

acts.name: The Final Stand
acts.intro_text: The Typhos Citadel looms before you. The Void Tyrant awaits within, master of numbers and symbols. This is the final battle.

boss.name: Void Tyrant
boss.intro: Reality warps as the Void Tyrant manifests, numbers and symbols orbiting his form...
boss.taunt: Letters are child's play! Let's see how you handle 1234567890!
boss.defeat: NO! The numbers... the symbols... they obey YOU now?!
boss.lore: The dark lord of Typhos, master of all keyboard corruption.

acts.completion_text: The Void Tyrant is vanquished. Keystonia is saved. You are a true Keyboard Master!

kingdom.name: Keystonia
kingdom.description: An ancient kingdom where writing and typing hold magical power. For centuries, the scribes of Keystonia have protected the realm through their keyboard mastery.
kingdom.history: Founded by the First Scribes, who discovered that precise keystrokes could channel magical energy. The kingdom flourished until the Typhos Horde emerged from the Void.

typhos_horde.name: The Typhos Horde
typhos_horde.description: Dark creatures born from typing errors and abandoned keystrokes. They feed on hesitation and mistakes.
typhos_horde.origin: Legend says the Typhos were created from the accumulated frustration of a million typos, given form by the Void Tyrant.
typhos_horde.weakness: Accurate, confident typing disrupts their essence. Combos are especially devastating.

elder_lyra.name: Elder Lyra
elder_lyra.title: Keeper of the Home Keys
elder_lyra.description: The wisest scribe in Keystonia. She has trained generations of keyboard mages and is the last master of the ancient typing arts.
elder_lyra.backstory: Once a young scribe who single-handedly defended Keystonia during the First Typhos Incursion. Now elderly but sharp, she sees great potential in you.
quotes: The keyboard is mightier than the sword.
Every master was once a disaster.
Your fingers know the way. Trust them.

shadow_scout_commander.name: Shadow Scout Commander
shadow_scout_commander.description: A fallen scribe who betrayed Keystonia for power.
shadow_scout_commander.backstory: Once Elder Lyra's most promising student, he grew impatient with the slow path of mastery and sought shortcuts through the Void.

void_tyrant.name: The Void Tyrant
void_tyrant.description: The ancient enemy of all scribes, born from the collective frustration of a million failed typists.
void_tyrant.backstory: No one knows the Void Tyrant's true origin. Some say he was the first typist to give up, his rage crystallizing into eternal malevolence.

game_start.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Welcome, young scribe. Dark times have befallen Keystonia.
The Typhos Horde grows stronger each day. But you... you have the gift.
Place your fingers on the home row: left hand on A S D F, right hand on J K L ;
Feel the small bumps on F and J? Those are your anchor keys. Always return to them.
Now, let me teach you the ancient keyboard magic...

day_start.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: A new day dawns. The Horde approaches.
Build your defenses wisely, then prepare for battle.
Remember: accuracy is power, speed is survival.

lesson_unlock.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Excellent! You have mastered {old_lesson}.
Now it is time to learn {new_lesson}.
New keys await your command. Practice well.

boss_victory.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Victory! The {boss_name} has fallen!
Your keyboard magic grows stronger.
But greater challenges lie ahead...

act_complete.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Act {act_number} complete: {act_name}
Your power grows. The Horde trembles.
Rest now, for the next act begins soon.

game_victory.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: You have done it! The Void Tyrant is defeated!
Keystonia is saved, and you are now a true Keyboard Master.
Your typing speed and accuracy will serve you well in all your future endeavors.
May your fingers fly swift and true, always.

wave_complete.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Well fought! The wave is repelled.
Prepare for the next assault.
Your fingers grow stronger with each battle.

day_complete.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: The day is won! Rest now, brave scribe.
Tomorrow brings new challenges.
Use this time to reflect on your technique.

perfect_wave.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Flawless victory! Not a single enemy breached our walls!
Your accuracy is remarkable!
The Horde will fear your name.

near_death.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Careful! Our defenses are crumbling!
Focus! One more breach could be our end!
Don't give up now - we can still turn this around!

comeback.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: That's the spirit! You're turning the tide!
From the brink of defeat, you rise!
A true scribe never surrenders!

first_combo_5.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Your first 5-combo! Feel that power surge?
Combos multiply your damage. Keep the streak alive!

first_combo_10.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: A 10-combo! You're channeling serious magic now!
Your fingers are becoming one with the keyboard!

first_tower.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Excellent! Your first tower rises!
Towers provide ranged support against the Horde.
Place them strategically to create kill zones.

first_wall.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: A wall stands strong!
Walls slow enemy advance, buying precious typing time.
Create chokepoints to maximize their effectiveness.

encouragement_struggling.speaker: Elder Lyra
lines: Don't be discouraged. Every master has struggled.
Slow down. Accuracy always beats speed.
Return to basics. Find your rhythm again.

home_row_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
home_row_1.title: The Foundation
lines: The home row is where all keyboard magic begins.
Place your left fingers on A S D F, your right on J K L ;
Your index fingers rest on F and J - feel the small bumps?
These bumps help you find home position without looking.
Master these eight keys, and you master the foundation of typing.
practice_tips: Keep your wrists floating, not resting on the desk.
Your fingers should be curved, like holding a small ball.
Press each key with a quick, light tap.

home_row_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
home_row_2.title: Expanding Home
lines: Now we add G and H - the bridge between your hands.
G is pressed by your left index finger reaching right.
H is pressed by your right index finger reaching left.
Keep your other fingers anchored on home row as you reach.
practice_tips: Only your index fingers move - keep other fingers still.
Return to F and J immediately after pressing G or H.
Practice the reach slowly at first, then build speed.

reach_row_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
reach_row_1.title: Reaching Up
lines: Time to reach for the top row! Your fingers will stretch upward.
R and T are reached by your left index finger.
Y and U are reached by your right index finger.
Practice reaching up and returning to home position smoothly.
practice_tips: Reach from the knuckle, not the fingertip.
Your hand position stays the same - only fingers move.
The index fingers do extra work - they're strong!

reach_row_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
reach_row_2.title: The Full Top Row
lines: Now master the entire top row of letters.
Each finger reaches straight up from its home position.
Q-W-E-R-T for the left hand, Y-U-I-O-P for the right.
Your pinkies handle Q and P at the edges.
practice_tips: The pinky stretch to Q and P is the hardest - be patient.
Keep your wrist steady as your fingers reach.
Practice each finger's reach individually, then combine.

upper_row_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
upper_row_1.title: Mastering Heights
lines: You've learned all the upper keys individually.
Now practice flowing between home row and top row.
The key is rhythm - don't rush, find your flow.
Accuracy now will build speed later.
practice_tips: Think of common letter pairs: TH, ER, IN, ON.
Let your fingers 'dance' between the rows.
If you miss a key, slow down and refocus.

upper_row_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
upper_row_2.title: Upper Mastery
lines: The entire upper keyboard is now at your command.
Home row and top row work together in harmony.
Notice how many common words use these keys?
THE, THEIR, THERE, WHERE, WHEN, THEN...
practice_tips: Common words become automatic with practice.
Trust your muscle memory - don't think, just type.
Speed comes naturally when accuracy is solid.

bottom_row_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
bottom_row_1.title: Into the Depths
lines: Now we descend to the bottom row.
Curl your fingers downward from home position.
Z-X-C-V-B for the left hand, N-M for the right.
The bottom row can feel awkward at first - that's normal!
practice_tips: The bottom row requires curling, not stretching.
Z is tricky for the pinky - practice it extra.
B and N are both index finger keys - learn which hand!

bottom_row_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
bottom_row_2.title: Completing the Depths
lines: Add the remaining bottom row keys.
The comma and period are pressed by your right middle and ring fingers.
The slash is handled by your right pinky.
Soon you'll command all 26 letters!
practice_tips: Punctuation keys use the same fingers as their column.
Period and comma are essential for sentences.
The slash shares a finger with semicolon - pinky power!

mixed_rows.speaker: Elder Lyra
mixed_rows.title: The Full Alphabet
lines: Congratulations! You now know all 26 letters!
This lesson mixes all three rows together.
Focus on returning to home position between words.
Let muscle memory guide you - trust your fingers.
practice_tips: Home position is your anchor - always return to it.
Think of each word as a journey that starts and ends at home.
Your fingers know the way - trust the training.

speed_alpha.speaker: Elder Lyra
speed_alpha.title: Building Speed
lines: You know the keys. Now we build speed.
Speed comes from rhythm, not rushing.
Type at a steady pace you can maintain accurately.
Gradually increase your tempo as accuracy stays high.
practice_tips: Speed is a byproduct of accuracy, not the goal.
Find a comfortable rhythm and gradually push it.
If accuracy drops, slow down immediately.

full_alpha.speaker: Elder Lyra
full_alpha.title: Full Mastery
lines: This is the test of a true keyboard mage.
All letters, any combination, at speed.
Keep your wrists straight and fingers curved.
You are nearly a master now!
practice_tips: At this level, your hands work as one unit.
Breathe steadily - tension is the enemy of speed.
Trust your training completely.

nexus_blend.speaker: Elder Lyra
nexus_blend.title: The Nexus
lines: All your training converges at the Nexus.
Here, speed and accuracy must be perfectly balanced.
Every key, every finger, working in harmony.
This is the way of the true scribe.
practice_tips: The Nexus is about flow - let the words pour through you.
Don't think about individual keys anymore.
You are the keyboard. The keyboard is you.

numbers_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
numbers_1.title: The Number Row
lines: The final frontier: the number row.
These keys are a long reach from home position.
Each finger stretches straight up to its number.
1-2-3-4-5 for left hand, 6-7-8-9-0 for right.
practice_tips: Numbers require the longest reach - take it slow.
Your whole hand may shift slightly for numbers.
Practice phone numbers, dates, and addresses.

numbers_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
numbers_2.title: Number Mastery
lines: Numbers flow as naturally as letters now.
Mix numbers and letters seamlessly.
Addresses, dates, codes - all at your fingertips.
The Void Tyrant's numeric magic cannot stop you!
practice_tips: Common number patterns: years (2024), times (10:30).
Practice typing your phone number and address.
Numbers in passwords need quick, accurate entry.

apex_mastery.speaker: Elder Lyra
apex_mastery.title: Apex Mastery
lines: You stand at the peak of keyboard mastery.
Letters, numbers, symbols - all bend to your will.
This is the ultimate test of everything you've learned.
Type with confidence. You are a Keyboard Master!
practice_tips: You have mastered what many never achieve.
Maintain your skills with regular practice.
Share your knowledge - teach others to type.

punctuation_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
punctuation_1.title: Punctuation Basics
lines: Words alone do not make sentences.
Punctuation gives your typing meaning and rhythm.
Period, comma, apostrophe - the basics of prose.
Each has its place, each its proper finger.

symbols_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
symbols_1.title: Symbol Introduction
lines: Beyond letters and numbers lie the symbols.
Programmers, mathematicians, and scribes all need these.
The Shift key unlocks their power.
Master them, and no text is beyond your reach.

training_basics.speaker: Elder Lyra
training_basics.title: First Steps
lines: Welcome, young defender. Before you can protect the kingdom, you must learn the fundamentals.
Place your left hand on A, S, D, and F. Feel the small bump on F? That's your guide home.
These four keys are your foundation. Master them, and all else will follow.
practice_tips: Keep your wrist straight and fingers curved like you're holding a small ball.

training_rhythm.speaker: Elder Lyra
training_rhythm.title: Finding Your Rhythm
lines: Now we add the right hand. J, K, L join your arsenal of keys.
Feel the bump on J - it mirrors F on the left. These bumps are your anchors.
Typing is like music. Find a steady rhythm and let your fingers dance.
practice_tips: Try typing to a mental beat - steady tempo builds speed naturally.

capitals_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
capitals_1.title: The Shift of Power
lines: Capital letters announce importance - the names of heroes, the start of sentences.
Use your pinky to hold Shift while another finger presses the letter.
The secret: use the OPPOSITE hand's Shift. Right hand letter? Left Shift. Left hand letter? Right Shift.
practice_tips: Press Shift before the letter, release after. Never same-hand Shift + letter.

capitals_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
capitals_2.title: Capital Mastery
lines: With full capital command, you can write proper names and titles with authority.
CamelCase, SHOUTING, Proper Nouns - all are within your grasp.
Speed comes from smooth Shift transitions. Practice makes permanent.
practice_tips: Practice typing your name with proper capitalization until it feels natural.

punctuation_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
punctuation_2.title: Punctuation Mastery
lines: Question marks, exclamation points, hyphens - the tools of expression.
These keys require Shift or reach, but they give your words power.
A well-placed exclamation can rally troops. A question can probe enemy weakness.
practice_tips: ! and ? require Shift - remember opposite-hand technique.

symbols_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
symbols_2.title: Symbol Mastery
lines: Brackets, braces, and special symbols - the arcane runes of the keyboard.
These keys are used by scribes and code-weavers alike.
Master them, and no inscription will be beyond your skill.
practice_tips: Bracket pairs always match - [ with ], { with }. Practice them together.

gauntlet_speed.speaker: Elder Lyra
gauntlet_speed.title: The Speed Gauntlet
lines: Speed! Raw, unrelenting speed!
Short words will fly at you. React instantly. Trust your fingers.
This is not about perfect form - this is about survival reflexes.
practice_tips: Don't think - react. Let muscle memory take over.

gauntlet_endurance.speaker: Elder Lyra
gauntlet_endurance.title: The Endurance Gauntlet
lines: Long words. Sustained focus. The true test of a keyboard warrior.
Each word is a marathon. Pace yourself. Breathe.
Accuracy matters more than speed here. One mistake costs precious time.
practice_tips: Read the whole word before you start typing. Plan your fingers' path.

gauntlet_chaos.speaker: Elder Lyra
gauntlet_chaos.title: The Chaos Gauntlet
lines: Letters. Numbers. Symbols. Everything. All at once.
This is the ultimate test. No pattern. No mercy. Pure chaos.
If you survive this, you can survive anything the Typhos Horde throws at you.
practice_tips: Stay calm. Chaos is just complexity you haven't mastered yet.

finger_gym_left.speaker: Elder Lyra
finger_gym_left.title: Left Hand Forge
lines: Your left hand guards the western keys. Today we strengthen it.
Q, W, E, R, T - A, S, D, F, G - Z, X, C, V, B. All yours to command.
A chain is only as strong as its weakest link. Find your weak fingers and forge them strong.

finger_guide.columns: Pinky: QAZ, Ring: WSX, Middle: EDC, Index: RFVTGB

practice_tips: Pay special attention to your pinky - it's often the weakest.

finger_gym_right.speaker: Elder Lyra
finger_gym_right.title: Right Hand Forge
lines: Your right hand guards the eastern keys. Now we strengthen it.
Y, U, I, O, P - H, J, K, L, ; - N, M and the punctuation marks.
Balance between hands creates harmony. Neither should dominate.

finger_guide.columns: Index: YUHJNM, Middle: IK,, Ring: OL., Pinky: P;/

practice_tips: Right pinky handles many keys - give it extra attention.

weak_fingers.speaker: Elder Lyra
weak_fingers.title: Pinky Strengthening
lines: Your pinkies are small but mighty. They guard the outer keys.
Q, A, Z on the left. P, ;, / on the right. The edges of your domain.
Weak pinkies slow your typing. Strong pinkies unlock true speed.
practice_tips: Isolate pinky practice - short sessions, frequent breaks.

pinky_power.speaker: Elder Lyra
pinky_power.title: Pinky Power
lines: Intensive pinky training begins now.
These small fingers control crucial territory - don't let them be your weakness.
Short bursts of focused practice build pinky strength faster than marathon sessions.
practice_tips: Stretch your pinkies between drills to prevent strain.

ring_finger_focus.speaker: Elder Lyra
ring_finger_focus.title: Ring Finger Focus
lines: Ring fingers often lack independence - they want to follow their neighbors.
W, S, X on the left. O, L, period on the right.
Train them to move alone and your typing will flow like water.
practice_tips: Practice lifting only your ring finger while keeping others still.

alternating_hands.speaker: Elder Lyra
alternating_hands.title: Hand Alternation
lines: The fastest typists alternate hands smoothly - left, right, left, right.
While one hand types, the other prepares. No wasted motion.
Words that alternate hands naturally flow faster. Learn to feel the rhythm.
practice_tips: Words like 'their', 'world', 'right' alternate hands - notice how fast they feel.

code_variables.speaker: Elder Lyra
code_variables.title: The Scribe's Variables
lines: Code-weavers name their spells with variables - descriptive names that hold power.
Underscores connect words. camelCase blends them. Both are common in the arcane arts.
Practice these patterns and you'll transcribe code with ease.
practice_tips: user_name, firstName, maxValue - these patterns appear constantly in code.

code_keywords.speaker: Elder Lyra
code_keywords.title: Keywords of Power
lines: Every spell has keywords - if, else, for, while, return.
These words command the flow of magic. Type them until they become instinct.
Speed with keywords separates apprentices from masters.
practice_tips: The most common keywords are short - 'if', 'for', 'var'. Drill them fast.

code_syntax.speaker: Elder Lyra
code_syntax.title: Syntax and Structure
lines: Brackets, parentheses, operators - the grammar of code.
() for functions. {} for blocks. [] for arrays. <> for comparisons.
Master these symbols and you can write any spell.
practice_tips: Brackets come in pairs - always type both, then fill the middle.

code_master.speaker: Elder Lyra
code_master.title: Code Mastery
lines: You've learned the pieces. Now we combine them all.
Full code sequences - variables, keywords, syntax, numbers - flowing together.
This is the true test of a code-weaver's typing skill.
practice_tips: Read code aloud in your head as you type - it helps with flow.

boss_grove_guardian.speaker: Elder Lyra
boss_grove_guardian.title: The Grove Guardian Awakens
lines: The ancient protector of the Evergrove stirs from slumber.
This guardian has watched over the forest for centuries. It will test your foundational skills.
Remember your training. Steady hands defeat ancient foes.
practice_tips: Boss battles are marathons - pace yourself and stay accurate.

boss_citadel_warden.speaker: Elder Lyra
boss_citadel_warden.title: The Citadel Warden
lines: The Warden of the Citadel blocks your path. A formidable guardian.
It will throw the full alphabet at you. No hiding behind simple keys.
You've trained for this. Show the Warden what you've learned.
practice_tips: Full alphabet coverage required - warm up all fingers before this fight.

boss_twilight_lord.speaker: Elder Lyra
boss_twilight_lord.title: The Twilight Lord
lines: Between light and shadow stands the Twilight Lord.
This master of duality will test your speed AND accuracy. Neither alone will suffice.
Find balance in your typing, and you will find victory.
practice_tips: Don't sacrifice accuracy for speed - the Twilight Lord punishes mistakes.

boss_eternal_scribe.speaker: Elder Lyra
boss_eternal_scribe.title: The Eternal Scribe
lines: The keeper of all written knowledge challenges you.
Punctuation, symbols, the full breadth of the keyboard - the Scribe commands it all.
Prove that your typing wisdom matches your speed.
practice_tips: The Scribe uses punctuation heavily - warm up your pinky Shift technique.

boss_fen_seer.speaker: Elder Lyra
boss_fen_seer.title: The Fen Seer
lines: In the mists of Mistfen, the Seer awaits. They see all possibilities.
Brackets, braces, the symbols of prophecy - the Seer speaks in code.
Decode their words faster than they can speak them.
practice_tips: Heavy symbol usage - practice bracket pairs before this battle.

boss_sunlord.speaker: Elder Lyra
boss_sunlord.title: The Sunlord Champion
lines: The blazing champion of Sunfields stands before you, radiant with power.
Speed is the Sunlord's weapon. Match it or be burned.
This is a test of pure typing velocity. Let your fingers fly like flames.
practice_tips: Speed is everything here - accuracy matters less. Go fast!

fire_realm_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
fire_realm_1.title: The Ember Path
lines: The Fire Realm tests speed above all else. Flames wait for no one.
Short words, rapid fire. Your fingers must dance like flames themselves.
Speed comes from relaxation, not tension. Let your hands flow.
practice_tips: Light, quick taps. Don't press hard - it slows you down.

fire_realm_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
fire_realm_2.title: The Inferno Core
lines: You've reached the heart of the volcano. The heat intensifies.
Longer words now, but the pace remains relentless.
Trust your training. Your fingers know the way.
practice_tips: Read ahead - see the next word before you finish the current one.

fire_realm_boss.speaker: Elder Lyra
fire_realm_boss.title: The Flame Tyrant
lines: The lord of fire stands before you, wreathed in flame.
This is pure speed combat. Hesitation means defeat.
You've trained in the fire - now become the flame itself!
practice_tips: Zone out the pressure. Let muscle memory take control.

ice_realm_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
ice_realm_1.title: The Frozen Approach
lines: The Ice Realm demands precision. Cold punishes carelessness.
Each keystroke must be deliberate. Quality over quantity.
Move methodically, like crossing a frozen lake.
practice_tips: Slow is smooth, smooth is fast. Accuracy builds speed.

ice_realm_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
ice_realm_2.title: The Glacier Heart
lines: Deep within the glacier, ancient ice holds secrets.
Long words require sustained focus. Don't let your attention drift.
The cold sharpens the mind. Use it.
practice_tips: Break long words into chunks mentally - type them as phrases.

ice_realm_boss.speaker: Elder Lyra
ice_realm_boss.title: The Frost Empress
lines: The queen of eternal winter awaits. Her gaze freezes the unworthy.
Perfect accuracy is your only path to victory.
One mistake and the cold will claim you. Type with certainty.
practice_tips: If unsure of a letter, pause briefly rather than guess wrong.

nature_realm_1.speaker: Elder Lyra
nature_realm_1.title: The Living Grove
lines: The forest breathes with life. It responds to those who type in harmony.
Natural rhythm - not too fast, not too slow. Find your flow.
The trees have watched typists for generations. They know true skill.
practice_tips: Find a comfortable pace you can sustain. Consistency is key.

nature_realm_2.speaker: Elder Lyra
nature_realm_2.title: The World Tree
lines: At the heart of all nature stands the World Tree.
Its roots touch all keyboards. Its branches reach all typists.
Prove your worth, and the tree will grant its blessing.
practice_tips: Connect with your natural typing rhythm - don't force unnatural speed.

nature_realm_boss.speaker: Elder Lyra
nature_realm_boss.title: The Ancient Treant
lines: The protector of the World Tree awakens. Older than memory itself.
It has seen countless typists. Only the balanced ones earn respect.
Show both speed AND accuracy. The Treant accepts nothing less.
practice_tips: Balance is everything. Neither speed nor accuracy alone will win.

biome_evergrove.speaker: Elder Lyra
biome_evergrove.title: Evergrove Woods
lines: The Evergrove's vocabulary speaks of trees, creatures, and forest life.
Oak, pine, deer, wolf - the words of the woodland.
Let the forest's calm focus guide your fingers.
practice_tips: Themed words help memory - visualize the forest as you type.

biome_stonepass.speaker: Elder Lyra
biome_stonepass.title: Stonepass Mountains
lines: The mountain's vocabulary is of stone, ore, and height.
Peak, cliff, mine, gem - words carved from rock itself.
Type with the steady determination of a dwarf miner.
practice_tips: Mountain words often have hard consonants - strike them firmly.

biome_mistfen.speaker: Elder Lyra
biome_mistfen.title: Mistfen Swamps
lines: The swamp speaks in murky, mysterious words.
Bog, mire, mist, haze - the vocabulary of the marshlands.
Navigate carefully. The Mistfen hides tricky letter combinations.
practice_tips: Swamp words have unusual patterns - read carefully before typing.

biome_sunfields.speaker: Elder Lyra
biome_sunfields.title: Sunfields Plains
lines: The open plains speak simply and clearly.
Farm, wheat, sun, wind - honest words for honest work.
The easiest biome - perfect for building confidence.
practice_tips: Common, simple words - great for speed practice.

bigram_flow.speaker: Elder Lyra
bigram_flow.title: Bigram Flow
lines: Two-letter patterns are the building blocks of typing fluency.
TH, ER, ON, AN - these combinations appear constantly.
Master the bigrams and whole words will flow naturally.
practice_tips: Think of TH, ER, ON as single units, not two letters.

double_letters.speaker: Elder Lyra
double_letters.title: Double Trouble
lines: Words with repeated letters require a special rhythm.
Book, moon, letter - the same finger strikes twice.
Don't rush the double - tap, tap, distinct and clear.
practice_tips: Lift your finger completely between double letters for clean strikes.

consonant_clusters.speaker: Elder Lyra
consonant_clusters.title: Consonant Clusters
lines: STR, SCR, THR - consonants clustering together.
These combinations challenge your finger coordination.
Practice them in isolation until they become automatic.
practice_tips: Consonant clusters often trip people up - slow down at first.

vowel_flow.speaker: Elder Lyra
vowel_flow.title: Vowel Flow
lines: A, E, I, O, U - the breath of language.
Vowels are typed with alternating hands mostly.
Let them flow smoothly between your hands.
practice_tips: Vowel sequences like 'ea', 'ou', 'ie' should feel like smooth handoffs.

rhythm_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
rhythm_words.title: Rhythm Builders
lines: Some words have a natural typing rhythm.
Element, minimum, premium - feel the cadence.
Finding rhythm transforms typing from work into flow.
practice_tips: Try to feel the beat of each word - some are almost musical.

twilight_whisper.speaker: Elder Lyra
twilight_whisper.title: Twilight Whisper
lines: In the space between light and dark, whispers guide you.
Soft keys, gentle touches. The twilight rewards subtlety.
Listen to your fingers - they know the path.
practice_tips: Light, whispering touches. Barely press the keys.

twilight_shadow.speaker: Elder Lyra
twilight_shadow.title: Twilight Shadow
lines: Dancing between light and dark, the shadow shows the way.
More keys now, but the same gentle approach.
Let your typing cast no shadow of doubt.
practice_tips: Stay relaxed - tension creates errors in the twilight.

twilight_void.speaker: Elder Lyra
twilight_void.title: Twilight Void
lines: Beyond shadow lies the void. The ultimate twilight test.
Here, only instinct guides you. Trust completely.
The void reveals what you truly know.
practice_tips: Don't think - just type. Let unconscious skill take over.

precision_bronze.speaker: Elder Lyra
precision_bronze.title: Bronze Precision
lines: The precision trials begin. Accuracy above all else.
90% accuracy is your target. Speed means nothing here.
Type slowly if you must, but type correctly.
practice_tips: If you feel yourself rushing, consciously slow down.

precision_silver.speaker: Elder Lyra
precision_silver.title: Silver Precision
lines: The silver trial demands more. 92% accuracy required.
One error in twelve keystrokes. Surgical precision.
Feel each key before you press. Certainty before action.
practice_tips: Visualize the key location before pressing - reduces errors.

precision_gold.speaker: Elder Lyra
precision_gold.title: Gold Precision
lines: The gold trial. 95% accuracy. Near perfection.
One error in twenty keystrokes. The elite standard.
This is where masters are separated from students.
practice_tips: At this level, mental state matters. Stay calm and focused.

time_trial_sprint.speaker: Elder Lyra
time_trial_sprint.title: Sprint Trial
lines: A race against time. Short words, maximum speed.
40+ WPM is your target. Push your limits.
Accuracy still matters - errors cost time.
practice_tips: Don't look at the WPM counter - it distracts. Just type.

time_trial_marathon.speaker: Elder Lyra
time_trial_marathon.title: Marathon Trial
lines: Sustained speed over distance. The true test of endurance.
45+ WPM across long words. No slowing down.
Pace yourself at the start. Save energy for the finish.
practice_tips: Steady rhythm is more important than burst speed.

legendary_forest.speaker: Elder Lyra
legendary_forest.title: Legendary Forest
lines: The forest, reborn in legendary difficulty.
Everything you learned, pushed to the extreme.
Only true masters complete this trial.
practice_tips: You know everything needed. Trust your training.

legendary_citadel.speaker: Elder Lyra
legendary_citadel.title: Legendary Citadel
lines: The citadel's ultimate trial. Legend difficulty.
Speed AND accuracy at the highest level.
Few have completed this. Fewer still with honor.
practice_tips: Legendary means no second chances. Every keystroke counts.

legendary_apex.speaker: Elder Lyra
legendary_apex.title: Legendary Apex
lines: Beyond mastery lies legend. This is the apex of all training.
Letters, numbers, symbols - everything, at legendary pace.
Complete this, and you join the immortal typists of Keystonia.
practice_tips: Breathe. Focus. Become one with the keyboard.

common_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
common_words.title: Common Words
lines: The most frequently used words in the language.
The, and, is, are - small words that appear everywhere.
Speed on common words dramatically improves overall WPM.
practice_tips: These words should become completely automatic - no thinking.

same_hand_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
same_hand_words.title: Same Hand Challenge
lines: Words typed primarily with one hand.
These are tricky - the usual left-right rhythm doesn't help.
Focus on finger independence within each hand.
practice_tips: Same-hand words require more finger independence - go slower.

intro_left_hand.speaker: Elder Lyra
intro_left_hand.title: Left Hand Foundation
lines: We begin with your left hand, defender.
Place your fingers on A, S, D, and F - these are your home keys.
Feel the small bump on F? That's your anchor point.
Let's build strength and confidence in your left hand.
practice_tips: Keep your wrist straight and fingers curved naturally.

intro_right_hand.speaker: Elder Lyra
intro_right_hand.title: Right Hand Foundation
lines: Now your right hand joins the battle.
Place your fingers on J, K, L, and semicolon.
Feel the bump on J? It mirrors the F key on your left.
Together, both hands will defend the kingdom.
practice_tips: Your hands should mirror each other in position.

intro_home_row.speaker: Elder Lyra
intro_home_row.title: The Home Row
lines: The home row is where your fingers rest between keystrokes.
A, S, D, F for the left hand. J, K, L, semicolon for the right.
Your index fingers rest on F and J - feel the bumps.
Always return to home position after reaching for other keys.
practice_tips: Practice finding home position without looking at the keyboard.

intro_pairs_left.speaker: Elder Lyra
intro_pairs_left.title: Left Hand Pairs
lines: Now we practice common letter pairs using your left hand.
Typing in pairs builds rhythm and speed.
Focus on smooth transitions between neighboring fingers.
practice_tips: Think of pairs as single units, not individual letters.

intro_pairs_right.speaker: Elder Lyra
intro_pairs_right.title: Right Hand Pairs
lines: Time to drill pairs with your right hand.
The same rhythm principles apply here.
Your right hand should feel as confident as your left.
practice_tips: If one hand feels weaker, give it extra practice.

intro_pairs_all.speaker: Elder Lyra
intro_pairs_all.title: Combined Pairs
lines: Now both hands work together on alternating pairs.
The best typing flows smoothly between hands.
This is the foundation of fast, accurate typing.
practice_tips: Alternating hands is natural - let the rhythm guide you.

home_row_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
home_row_words.title: Home Row Words
lines: Time to type real words using only home row keys.
Words like 'add', 'fall', 'salad' - all from the home row.
This is where letters become language.
practice_tips: Read the whole word before typing - don't hunt and peck.

reach_row_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
reach_row_words.title: Reach Row Words
lines: Now we form words using the reach row keys.
Your fingers extend upward to G, H, T, Y and neighbors.
Reach confidently, then return home.
practice_tips: Keep your wrists stable as your fingers reach upward.

bottom_row_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
bottom_row_words.title: Bottom Row Words
lines: Words from the bottom row - Z, X, C, V, B, N, M.
The bottom row requires a downward reach.
Master this and you command the entire alphabet.
practice_tips: The bottom row often uses pinkies - strengthen them!

full_alpha_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
full_alpha_words.title: Full Alphabet Words
lines: All 26 letters are now at your command.
Type words from across the entire keyboard.
Your fingers should flow naturally to any key.
practice_tips: If you hesitate on certain letters, practice them more.

hand_alternation_drill.speaker: Elder Lyra
hand_alternation_drill.title: Hand Alternation
lines: The fastest typists alternate hands smoothly.
While one hand types, the other prepares.
This drill builds that crucial coordination.
practice_tips: Feel the rhythm of left-right-left-right typing.

double_letter_drill.speaker: Elder Lyra
double_letter_drill.title: Double Letter Drill
lines: Words with repeated letters require special technique.
The same finger must strike twice in quick succession.
Lift cleanly between strikes for distinct keypresses.
practice_tips: Don't rush double letters - clarity beats speed.

bigram_common.speaker: Elder Lyra
bigram_common.title: Common Bigrams
lines: Bigrams are two-letter combinations that appear frequently.
TH, HE, IN, ER - these patterns are everywhere in English.
Learning them as units dramatically improves your speed.
practice_tips: Think of common bigrams as single keystrokes in your mind.

pinky_ring_strength.speaker: Elder Lyra
pinky_ring_strength.title: Pinky and Ring Strength
lines: Your weakest fingers need the most training.
Pinky and ring fingers control important keys.
This drill builds their strength and independence.
practice_tips: Isolate these fingers - don't let others compensate.

weak_fingers_words.speaker: Elder Lyra
weak_fingers_words.title: Weak Finger Words
lines: Now apply your stronger weak fingers to real words.
Words heavy in Q, Z, P, and other pinky keys.
Every finger must carry its weight in battle.
practice_tips: Accuracy first - speed will follow with practice.

mixed_case.speaker: Elder Lyra
mixed_case.title: Mixed Case Typing
lines: Capital letters require coordination with Shift.
Use the opposite hand's pinky for Shift.
Proper names, sentences, acronyms - all need this skill.
practice_tips: Press Shift before the letter, release after - smooth motion.

email_patterns.speaker: Elder Lyra
email_patterns.title: Email Patterns
lines: The modern defender must master digital communication.
Email addresses use @, dots, and underscores.
These symbols are essential in today's world.
practice_tips: Learn the symbol key positions by feel, not sight.

sentence_basics.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_basics.title: Basic Sentences
lines: From words to sentences - a major step forward.
Capital at the start, period at the end.
Spacing between words must be consistent.
practice_tips: One space after periods. Keep rhythm steady.

sentence_home_row.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_home_row.title: Home Row Sentences
lines: Complete sentences using primarily home row keys.
Simple sentences build confidence in sentence flow.
Focus on smooth word-to-word transitions.
practice_tips: Don't pause between words - maintain typing flow.

sentence_common.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_common.title: Common Sentences
lines: Frequently used sentence patterns and phrases.
The quick brown fox, hello world, and more.
These classic sentences test all your skills.
practice_tips: Famous typing sentences are famous for a reason - they work!

sentence_pangrams.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_pangrams.title: Pangram Practice
lines: Pangrams contain every letter of the alphabet.
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
These sentences ensure complete keyboard coverage.
practice_tips: Pangrams reveal which letters need more practice.

sentence_intermediate.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_intermediate.title: Intermediate Sentences
lines: Longer sentences with varied vocabulary.
Your endurance and accuracy will be tested.
Maintain rhythm across the entire sentence.
practice_tips: Read ahead to anticipate upcoming words.

sentence_advanced.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_advanced.title: Advanced Sentences
lines: Complex sentences with challenging vocabulary.
Punctuation, capitalization, numbers - everything.
This is the final test of sentence typing mastery.
practice_tips: Stay calm - complexity is just many simple parts together.

sentence_fantasy.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_fantasy.title: Fantasy Sentences
lines: Sentences drawn from the lore of Keystonia.
Dragons, castles, magic - the words of our world.
Type the tales of our kingdom's heroes.
practice_tips: Immerse yourself in the story as you type.

sentence_coding.speaker: Elder Lyra
sentence_coding.title: Coding Sentences
lines: Programming requires its own sentence patterns.
Variable declarations, function calls, comments.
The syntax of code is a language unto itself.
practice_tips: Symbols like {}, [], and () need special attention.

posture: Sit up straight with your feet flat on the floor.
Keep your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
Your wrists should float, not rest on the desk.
Position your screen at eye level to avoid neck strain.
Take breaks every 20-30 minutes to stretch.
Relax your shoulders - tension travels to your fingers.
technique: Curve your fingers naturally, like holding a ball.
Strike keys with your fingertips, not your nails.
Use a light touch - don't pound the keys.
Keep your thumbs hovering over the spacebar.
Let your fingers do the work, not your hands.
Press and release quickly - don't hold keys down.
practice: Practice for 15-20 minutes at a time, then rest.
If you make the same mistake twice, slow down.
Consistent daily practice beats long occasional sessions.
Focus on your weakest keys during warm-up.
Celebrate small improvements - progress is progress!
rhythm: Find a steady rhythm and maintain it.
Imagine each word as a single flowing motion.
Pause briefly between words, not between letters.
Music can help establish a typing rhythm.
Think of typing like playing a musical instrument.
Let the rhythm carry you through difficult words.
home_row: Always return to home position after each word.
The F and J keys have bumps - use them to find home.
Your fingers should rest lightly on A S D F and J K L ;
Home position is your anchor - never lose it.
If you get lost, find F and J first.
Home row is your foundation - build everything on it.
errors: When you make an error, don't panic. Stay calm.
Identify which finger made the mistake.
Slow down and focus on accuracy for the next few words.
Errors often come from rushing - patience is key.
Learn from mistakes - they show what needs practice.
A mistake is just a lesson in disguise.
mental: Focus on the current word, not the whole text.
Don't look at the keyboard - trust your training.
Visualize success before you start typing.
If frustrated, take a short break and return fresh.
warm_up: Start each session with home row exercises.
Type the alphabet slowly to wake up your fingers.
Stretch your fingers and wrists before long sessions.
Begin slowly and gradually increase speed.
A good warm-up prevents strain and errors.
advanced: Anticipate the next key while pressing the current one.
Learn common word patterns and type them as units.
The best typists type words, not letters.
troubleshooting: Hitting wrong keys? Slow down and check hand position.
Fingers tired? Take a break and stretch.
Accuracy dropping? Return to easier exercises.
Speed plateaued? Focus on eliminating pauses.
Specific key problems? Practice that finger's column.
Consistency issues? Check your posture and hand position.
